To
e Deputye and c
o
pany at Middel
b
20 June 1592

page.lettertext:
fol.222r
Belgia 1592 June 20 The De
s
and Com
p
at Midel
l
to M
r
Bodly
Right wo
r
shipfull,
at letter of her
Ma
tie
w
ch
was bro
[ught]
by
M
r
Burnham
was both delivered and answered
about three weekes agoe. But to so muche as was concer
[ned]
yo
r
affaires w
t
the states, there was no answear they
returned. For knowing by the date of her Hig
nes
l
re
that she was not then advertised what order had bin
taken between their and yo
r
Committies: and considering
there w
t
all that somew
at
was concluded w
t
yo
r
owne good
liking, and a further time assigned for according other
pointes w
ch
were left undecided they thought it war
[.]
sufficient to satisfie her Ma
tie
. Howbeit to the e
[nd]
you may receave a full redresse of all yo
r
griefes,
[I]
doe thinke it expedient,
at you should sette downe
[in]
wrting, w
at
inconvenience you finde in this former pro
ceeding, and how the rest of those pointes
at are he
[re]
in suspense, being otherwise resolved, then you shall
require may turne you to prejudice. And I will tak
[e]
therupon a fitte opportunitie, both to plead yo
r
excep
[.]
to yo
r
best advantage, and to urge w
t
all
at Article
[of]
the Ancient Treaty, w
t
the house of Burgundie
[as]
it is alleaged by her Ma
tie
. Wherof I pray you if
[.]
have it to send me the wordes, as they are in t
[he]
Article.
And so assuring yow alwaies,
at for
[.]
as I am able there shall no man in any thing
[be]
readier then my self to advance yo
r
desires,
[.]
all yo
r
actions to gods good direction. Hage
[June]
20 1592.
